abstract.p: Brown University varsity team advances to final against Germany's under-23 national team at Henley Royal Regatta at Henley-on-Thames in London; other results noted (S)

block.p: Brown University is having a Henley Royal Regatta to remember on Henley-on-Thames in London, as both its heavyweight varsity and junior varsity eights advanced in the Ladies' Challenge Plate and Temple Challenge Cup yesterday.

The Bruins varsity faced the University of California yesterday, gaining the lead at the start of its race. Californa made a run at Brown as the crews raced down the course, reducing the Bruins' lead to a quarter boatlength at the three-quarter-mile mark, but could do no more. Brown drew away to eliminate California from the regatta and advance to today's final, where it will meet Germany's under-23 national team.

Brown University is having a Henley Royal Regatta to remember on Henley-on-Thames in London, as both its heavyweight varsity and junior varsity eights advanced in the Ladies' Challenge Plate and Temple Challenge Cup yesterday.

The Bruins varsity faced the University of California yesterday, gaining the lead at the start of its race. Californa made a run at Brown as the crews raced down the course, reducing the Bruins' lead to a quarter boatlength at the three-quarter-mile mark, but could do no more. Brown drew away to eliminate California from the regatta and advance to today's final, where it will meet Germany's under-23 national team.

The anticipated rubber match between the lightweight varsities of Columbia, the Eastern Sprint champion, and Yale, which subsequently defeated Columbia by six-tenths of a second to claim the national championship, got away from Columbia at the start. The two eights raced down the entire course with no more than three-quarters of a boatlength separating them, with Yale winning by a half-length.
Finals in all 17 cup events will be determined tomorrow.
